page.title: 01FRAMPTON - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a rural area with four separate communities within it. The largest place is{Wyberton}which is now almost a suburb of Boston. There are council and private housing estates supporting a primary school.{Frampton} a smaller village has developed along the main roads of its area. There is no shop and community life centres around the Church and Village Hall. The hamlet of Frampton West End has no shop but the church hall is used for social functions.{Kirton End}has a post office but no hall. Most land is used for{agriculture}and{ {horticulture,}and a ministry { {experimental station}is sited on Willington Road. There are very few hedges in the area, most field boundaries being ditches.The{old {railway line}will soon be lost when the new A16 is built.
